utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Man this is weird. You ever realize Captain Crunch's eyebrows are actually on his hat?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That's what's weird? Joey, the man's been captain of a cereal for the last 40 years.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Waaa-aaah.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: The spoon. You licked and-and you put. You licked and you put.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, so.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well don't you see how gross that is? I mean that's like you using my toothbrush. You used my toothbrush?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, that was only 'cause I used the red one to unclog the drain.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Mine is the red one! Oh God. Can open, worms everywhere.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, why can't we use the same toothbrush, but we can use the same soap?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Because soap is soap. It's self-cleaning.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Alright, well next time you take a shower, think about the last thing I wash and the first thing you wash.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: MONICA and PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ooh, look at you fancy lads. What's the occasion?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, you know that guy that's on my show that's in a coma? He's havin' a brunch.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, ready when you are.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Okey-doke.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I can't believe you guys are actually getting tattoos.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Excuse me, you guys are getting tattoos?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yes, but you can not tell Ross 'cause I want to surprise him.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Wow, this is wild. What're you gonna get?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um, I'm getting a lily for my Mom. 'Cause her name's Lily.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Wow, that's lucky. What if her name was Big Ugly Splotch?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So where you gettin' it?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I think on my shoulder.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What? What's on your shoulder?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um, a chip. A tattoo, I'm getting a tattoo.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: A tattoo? Why, why would you want to do that? Hi.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hi. Well hey, you don't - you don't think they're kind of cool?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, sorry I don't. Tell me why would anyone pay someone to scar their body for life? What if it doesn't come out right Phoebe? Then it's like, I don't know, havin' a bad hair cut all the time. Why's everyone staring at me?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ross, come sign this birthday card for dad. Rich is gonna be here any minute.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oooh, Rich is goin' to the party too, huh?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, he's my parents' best friend, he has to be there.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, is today the day you're gonna tell them about you two?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah. It's my dad's birthday, I decided to give him a stroke.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, I think you should tell them.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No, I don't even know how serious he is about me. Until I do, I'm not telling them anything.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I don't know, I don't think mom and dad would mind. Remember when you were 9 and Richard was 30, how dad used to say, 'God I hope they get together.'

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Alright, shall we?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: OK, wait, wait, wait, wait. You know what? Ross, let's - let's switch places. You get in the middle. No un-, ya know, unless this looks like we're trying to cover something up.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Monica, Monica, you could come in straddling him, they still wouldn't believe it. We're here.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Oh hi kids. Hi darling.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Happy birthday dad.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Oh thank you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi ma.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Happy birthday.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Well, you kids thank Dr. Burke for the ride?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, actually mom, I think Monica thanked him for the both of us.

utterance.speaker: FRIEND
utterance.content: Well, you kids take the train in?

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: No, Richard Burke gave them a ride.

utterance.speaker: FRIEND
utterance.content: Oh. Speaking of whom, I hear he's got some 20-year-old twinkie in the city.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Finger cramp. Oh God, sorry. Here, let me get that mom.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Sooo, Richard's shopping in the junior section.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Are we still on that?

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: We just know she's got the IQ of a napkin.

utterance.speaker: FRIEND
utterance.content: She's probably not even very pretty, just young enough so that everything is still pointing up.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Can you believe this place?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I know, this is a great apartment.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ah, I was just in the bathroom, and there's mirrors on both sides of you. So when you're in there it's like you're peein' with the Rockettes.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Wow, there's my fantasy come true. No, seriously.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey! We were just sayin', great apartment man.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, can you see me in a place like this?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh that's all right fellas, I saw a kitchen this morning - on TV. Stop talking. OK.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: C'mon, tell us.

utterance.speaker: FRIEND
utterance.content: Yeah, is she really 20.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: I am not telling you guys anything.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: C'mon Rich, it's my birthday, let me live vicariously.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Dad, you really don't want to do that.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Ahh, what's a little mid-life crisis between friends?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Jack, would you let it go?

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Look, I know what you're going through. When I turned 50 I got the Porsche. You... you got your own little speedster.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Guys. Seriously, it is not like that.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Tell you what, maybe one of these weekends you can borrow the car and I cou. . .

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Dad, I beg you not to finish that sentence.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: What? I'm kidding. You know I'd never let him touch the Porsche.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK Rach, which, which lily? This lily or that lily?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well I. . .

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I like this lily. It's more open, ya know, and that's like my mom. She had a more open, giving spirit. Ooh, Foghorn Leghorn, ooh.

utterance.speaker: TATTOO ARTIST
utterance.content: Alright, blonde girl, you're in room two, not so blonde girl, you're with me.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: You're not going?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What? Is it - is this 'cause of what Ross said?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No. Well, yeah, maybe.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I don't believe this. Is this how this relationship's gonna work? Ross equals boss. I mean, c'mon what is this, 1922?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What's 1922?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Just, you know, long time ago. Well, when men used to tell women what to do - a lot. And then there was suffrage, which is a good thing but is sounds horrible. Do you want to get this tattoo?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yes I do, it's just that Ross is. . .

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, hey, HEY. Is your boyfriend the boss of you?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, who is the boss of you?!!

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No. You are the boss of you. Now you march your heinie in there and get that heart tattooed on your hip. GO!!

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: How ya doin'?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm a twinkie.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Really? I'm a hero.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, this is so hard.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. I hate it too. Look, maybe we should just tell them.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Maybe we should just tell your parents first.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: My parents are dead.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: God, you are so lucky. I mean, I mean. . . you know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: I know, I know. Just hang in there, OK. OK, I'll go out first, alright.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Judy, going to the bathroom, good for you.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Thank you Richard, I appreciate the support.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Honey. Honey, have you seen my Harmon Kilerbrew bat? Bob doesn't believe I have one.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: I have no idea. Did you know Richard has a twinkie in the city?

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: I know. He's like a new man. It's like a scene from Cocoon.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: I just never would have pictured Richard with a bimbo.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Apparently, he told Johnny Shapiro that she's quite a girl. In fact, he told Johnny that he thinks he's falling in love with her.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: I tell you, I've never seen him this happy.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: So Jack, you ever think about trading me in for a younger model?

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Of course not. With you it's like I've got two 25-year-olds.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Oh Jack stop.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: C'mon, it's my birthday.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Can we drop this? I am not interested in the guy's apartment.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh please, I saw the way you were checking out his mouldings. You want it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Why would I want another apartment, huh? I've already got an apartment that I love.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well it wouldn't kill you to say it once in a while.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Alright, you want the truth? I'm thinkin' about it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I'm 28 years old, I've never lived alone, and I'm finally at a place where I've got enough money that I don't need a roommate anymore.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Woah, woah, woah. I don't need a roommate either, OK? I can afford to live here by myself. Ya know, I may have to bring in somebody once a week to lick the silverware.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What're you gettin' so bent out of shape for, huh? It's not like we agreed to live together forever. We're not Bert and Ernie.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Look, you know what? If this is the way you feel, then maybe you should take it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well that's how I feel.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well then maybe you should take it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well then maybe I will.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Fine with me.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Great. Then you'll be able to spend more quality time with your real friends, the spoons.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Who's drink can I freshen?

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Almost time for cake.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Mon, Mon, are you OK?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You remember that video I found of mom and dad?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, I just caught the live show.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Eww.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey there.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Nothing, I just heard something nice about you.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Humm, really?

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Richard. Richard. Your son isn't seeing anyone is he?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uhh, not that I know of.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Well, I was thinking, why doesn't he give Monica a call?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: That - that's an idea.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, actually, I'm already seeing someone.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Oh?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Oh?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ohh.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: She never tells us anything. Ross, did you know Monica's seeing someone?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Mom, there are so many people in my life. Some of them are seeing people and some of them aren't. Is that crystal?

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: So, who's the mystery man?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, uh, he's a doctor.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: A real doctor?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No, a doctor of meat. Of course he's a real doctor. And he's handsome, and he's sweet, and know you'd like him.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Well that's wonderful. . . I

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Mom, it's OK.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: It is Judy.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Jack. Could you come in here for a moment? NOW!

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Found it.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'll take that dad.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: It seems your daughter and Richard are something of an item.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: That's impossible, he's got a twinkie in the city.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Dad, I'm the twinkie.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: You're the twinkie?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: She's not a twinkie.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Al-alright, l-look you guys, this is the best relationship I've been in. . .

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Oh please, a relationship.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes, a relationship. For your information I am crazy about this man.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Am I supposed to stand here and listen to this on my birthday?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Dad, dad this is a good thing for me. Ya know, and you even said yourself, you've never seen Richard happier.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: When did I say that?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Upstairs in the bathroom right before you felt up mom.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh that looks so good, oh I love it.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I know, so do I. Oh Phoebe, I'm so glad you made me do this. OK, lemme se yours.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ahh. OK, let's see yours again.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Phoebe we just saw mine, let me see yours.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh OK. Oh no, oh it's gone, that's so weird, I don't know how-where it went.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You didn't get it?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Why didn't you get it?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Phoebe, how would you do this to me? This was all your idea.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know, I know, and I was gonna get it but then he came in with this needle and uh, di-, did you know they do this with needles?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Really? You don't say, because mine was licked on by kittens.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey listen, I'm sorry about what happened. . .

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah me too.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I know. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah. So do we need to hug here or. . .

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, we're alright.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So I got ya something.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Plastic spoons. Great.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Lick away my man.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: These'll go great in my new place. You know, 'till I get real ones.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, I can't use these forever. I mean, let's face it, they're no friend to the environment.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No-no, I mean what, what's this about your new place?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I'm movin' out like we talked about.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well I didn't think that was serious. Ya know I thought that was just a fight.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, it was a fight. . . based on serious stuff, remember. About how I never lived alone or anything. I just think it would be good for me, ya know, help me to grow or. . . whatever.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, there you go.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, are you cool with this. I mean, I don't want to leave you high and dry.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, no, I've never been lower or wetter. I'll be fine. I'll just turn your, uh, bedroom into a game room or somethin', you know, put the foosball table in there.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Woah. Why do you get to keep the table?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I did pay for half of it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah. And uh, I paid for the other half.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright I'll tell you what, I'll play you for it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Alright, you're on. I can take two minutes out of my day to kick your ass.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Your little men are gonna get scored on more times than your sister.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Woah, woah, woah, woah. Which sister?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So, are you sorry that I told them?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: No, it's been a long time since your dad and I went running.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh. Well did you get it? Let me see.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Is Ross here?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No he went out to get pizza.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh really, OK.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That's great.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Very tasteful.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Wanna see mine, wanna see mine?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What? You didn't get one.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, well then what is this?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: What're we looking at? That blue freckle?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, that's my tattoo.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: That is not a tattoo, that is a nothing. I finally got her back in the chair, bairly touched her with a needle, she jumped up screaming, and that was it.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, hi. For your information this is exactly what I wanted. This is a tattoo of the earth as seen from a great distance. It's the way my mother sees me from heaven.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, what a load of crap. That is a dot. Your mother is up in heaven going, 'Where the hell is my lily, you wuss?' OK, Phoebe, that is not a tattoo, this is a tattoo.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You got a tattoo?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Maybe. But just a little one. Phoebe got the whole world.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Lemme see.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well it's really. . . sexy. I wouldn't have thought it would be but. . . wow.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, so uh, is it sore or can you do stuff?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, save us some pizza.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Get out of the corner. Pass it, pass it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Stop talkin' to your men.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yes! And the table is mine.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, you guys are still gonna come visit me, right?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh yeah, you got the big TV. We'll be over there all the time. . . except when we are here.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know you're just moving uptown but I'm really gonna miss you.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I know, how can you not be accross the hall anymore.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah, who's gonna eat all our food, and tie up our phone lines, and - is that my bra? What the hell you doin' with my bra?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh no-no, it's uh, it's not what you think. We uh, we used it to, you know, fling water balloons off the roof. Remember that, those junior high kids couldn't even get theirs accross the street.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, I remember.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, let's bring the rest of these down to the truck.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, uhh, em, you want me to uh, give you a hand with the foosball table?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Naa, you keep it, you need the practice.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So, I guess this is it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, right, yeah, I guess so.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Listen, uh, I don't know when I'm gonna see you again.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, I'm guessing uh, tonight at the coffee house.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Right, yeah. OK. Um, take care.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah.
